definition: development cycle/development period/also written 開發週期|开发周期

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to make a circuit/to circle/circle/circumference/lap/cycle/complete/all/all over/thorough/to help financially
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: Generics can help you resolve coding problems earlier in the development cycle.
sentences.chinese: 泛型可以帮助您在开发周期的早期解决编码问题。

sentences.english: Early in the development lifecycle, one uses simulation and analysis tools.
sentences.chinese: 在开发周期的前期阶段，使用仿真和分析工具。

sentences.english: Design-time governance controls all phases and activities around the software development lifecycle.
sentences.chinese: 设计时期治理控制软件开发周期内的所有阶段和活动。

sentences.english: The process of tailoring the framework usually occurs early in the development cycle.
sentences.chinese: 裁剪框架的过程通常发生在开发周期的早期。

sentences.english: A typical development cycle starts by capturing and analyzing business requirements and goals.
sentences.chinese: 典型的开发周期从获取和分析商业需求和目的开始。

definition: to exploit (a resource)/to open up (for development)/to develop
time allocated for a project/completion date
developer (of real estate, a commercial product etc)
time-consuming/to take a period of (x amount of time)
to be in operation/to do business/(of train, bus etc) to be in service/operation/service
to hit the market (of a new product)
